english.segment1: If you insist on pictures of shorelines. then i insist on pages of your lines meant for me, to be sent to me.
english.segment2: Remember watching the storms from the lifeguard stand. Remember feeling the tingling in my fingertips. when I touched your lips.
english.segment3: And I recall how you sat on the same side of me, it always seemed that you'd always be on my side. You're my best side.
english.segment4: And it's early June, so the sand's still dry, and you have got the boldest eyes, and I can't help but think it's right, that inside you it's me I'll find. And I'm still waiting.
english.segment5: And it's early June, so the sand's still dry, and the storm off shore is not far behind. And I'm still waiting.
english.segment6: And sometimes you don't say a thing for a long while. And the ships off shore hold stories that we'd make. And sometimes we are held at bay by these miles. But less of you is more than I can take.
english.segment7: And the moments that we've shared could last a lifetime. And the faith I have in us will keep you near. And several of these miles placed in between us. mean several of these words being sent by mail. I hope this letter finds you well.
